The Batman: A Gritty Take on the Caped Crusaderâ€™s Story

By Kyle Boulton

Michael Athey looks at Pattinsonâ€™s performance and the dark aesthetic of the new Batman film

Review: The Northman

By Kyle Boulton

Sophia Ash excavates the bloody core of Robert Eggers' unrelenting blockbuster

The Adventures of Tintin

Innovative action sequences more than justify the use of animation - if only it felt like more effort had gone into everything else

Top 5 Horror Classics

As Halloween is upon us, it's time for blood, gore, and a few girlish screams as we count down the five greatest horror films of all time

Contagion

The basic plot is this: there's a virus, one person gets sick, more people get sick, lots of people die, and some other people run around like headless chickens looking for a cure as the virus spreads and the death toll climbs. It doesn't leave very much to the imagination and it doesn't take very long to figure out where the film is going

Why Roger the Codger deserves Moore praise

Stephen Thorne makes the case that Sir Roger's the best Bond of them all

The Three Musketeers

There have been many adaptations of Dumas' <em>The Three Musketeers</em>, so coming up with a fresh interpretation is a challenge for any director

Everything Must Go

Will Ferrell is a fine actor, and in a film with more to say could really have done something special: his depiction of a man at rock bottom is consistently effortless

Johnny English Reborn

<em>Johnny English Reborn</em> is an inadequate vehicle for a comedy legend like Rowan Atkinson

Red State

If you can get past its disjointed nature and slow pace, the story and the performances make <em>Red State</em> a captivating film

Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy

Tomas Alfredson's attachment to rigid realism often detracts from the viewing pleasure of an audience who will often struggle to keep track of the somewhat convoluted plot

Melancholia

Anticipating a sci-fi heavy film a la Armageddon, my expectations were not met. They were surpassed. Visually stunning and emotionally draining, Lars von Trier's Melancholia delivers with this apocalyptic drama.

Smoking - Certificate 18

New research has suggested that films featuring cigarettes are unsuitable for teenagers. Vicky Morris asks whether such proposals are worth listening to.

Drive

Ryan Gosling gives a stand-out performance in Danish director Nicolas Winding Refn's latest offering.

Friends With Benefits

<em>Friends with Benefits</em> has come to our screens not long after the <em>No Strings Attached</em>, concerning itself with the same subject and in actual fact seeming to follow an almost identical plot

Tyrannosaur

Disturbing, brutal and incredibly moving, Tyrannosaur fearlessly exposes the unseen and accepted violence of the everyday. Rating: ****

Midnight in Paris

<em>Midnight in Paris</em> transports us back to a decadent, sumptuous era in a fantasy transferred elegantly into reality: Woody Allen's fantasy, to be exact

Crazy, Stupid, Love

Even if it's occasionally formulaic, with a couple of genuinely good twists and turns, and the ambition of its multi-generational story <em>Crazy, Stupid, Love </em>, is thoroughly entertaining

The Inbetweeners Movie

This summer we join the nation's favourite incompetent teenagers on their quest to Malia for "sex, booze, tits, sex, fanny, minge . . . sex, tits, booze and . . . sex".

Rise of the Planet of the Apes

What has consistently made the <em>Planet of the Apes</em> films so fascinating is of course the inclusion of apes. Not necessarily because they scream and shout and make other amusing guttural noises; or because they wield a supra-human strength and are capable of smashing shit up, but more due to the fact that they so closely resemble us human beings.

Arrietty

<em>Arrietty</em> doesn't represent the first time that the much loved Studio Ghibli has dabbled in the art of adaptation. <em>Howl's Moving Castle</em>, and <em>Ponyo</em> both finding their original source material in the work of established children's authors.

Last Night

The new Keira Knightley film verges on being similar to Closer staring Jude Law, but is more concise in its delivery. Paris Bennett lifts the lid on this unfortunately overlooked 90-minute film. Rating: ****

Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

It is the end of Harry Potter. This film makes it go out with a bang, a smile, a tear. Yates has seen us through the end admirably well, even though he hasn't always tapped into the rich story in his hands with bold depth

Blockbuster Season

From the final Harry Potter to a new Planet of the Apes movie, Michael Allard previews the big films of the summer (Thumbnail credit Above: Daniel Craig in &lt;em&gt;Cowboys and Aliens&lt;/em&gt;)

Top 5 Banned Movies

By James Bithell

<em>The Human Centipede II</em> isn't the first movie to feel the wrath of the BBFC - here are five classics that were once on the UK banned list

The Human Centipede II

This month the BBFC refused to certify a film for commercial release in the UK. Adrian Choa looks at what the fuss is all about

Green Lantern

<em>Green Lantern</em> is one of those films that gets everything right apart from acting and plot. It's a terrible movie, shrouded in great cinematography, spellbinding visual effects and a gloriously dramatic score

Senna

To refer to Asif Kapadia as the director of <em>Senna</em> is in many ways misleading. Leaving behind him a wealth of archive footage Senna can be said to have narrated his own life, and so Kapadia has not had to shoot a single frame of this movie

X-Men: First Class

Abandon all your preconceptions about comic book films at the door - you won't be needing them

There's nothing beautiful left to see

Guillem Morales talks to Gareth Davies about his latest film <em>Julia's Eyes</em> (Thumbnail credit Belen Rueda in Julia's Eyes)

Top 5 Terence Malick Movies

By James Bithell

Having just won the Palme d'Or at Cannes, here's our pick of this 67-year-old American filmmaker's best offerings to the silver screen

Movie piracy: on stranger tides

The movie industry isn't expendable, argues <em>Christopher Fraser</em>, but neither are those targeted for illegal movie downloads
